intro: Randia fischeri var. major, commonly known as the Florida hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a shrub that typically grows in wetland habitats, such as swamps and marshes. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are usually pink or red in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants.
